description.en: The course is based on the analysis of works of both Russian and European writers who tried to elaborate the image of the neighbor, to find common and different features in Russia and Europe and to find the ways of cooperation in the changing world. The influence of the war against Ukraine on the image of Russia and Russians in the modern world
description.et: Kursus on koostatud vene ja euroopa autorite teoste analüüsil, kes püüdsid vormida naabri kuvandit, leida ühised jooned ja erinevused Venemaa ja Euroopa vahel ning nende vastastikust mõju muutuvas maailmas. VF sõja mõju Venemaa ja venelaste kuvandile.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give the audience general notion on the dynamics of images of the Russians and Europeans in the eyes of each other during the history of Russia. The changes in the nowadays war context
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade sellest, kuidas muutus eurooplaste ettekujutus venelastest ja venelaste oma eurooplastest Venemaa ajaloo ulatuses. Muudatused tänapäeva sõja kontekstis

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the student
1) gets acquainted with the texts by European writers devoted to Russia and the Russians;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) teab euroopa kirjanike tekste, mis on pühendatud Venemaale ja venelastele.

learning_outcomes.en: 2) gets acquainted with the texts by Russian writers devoted to Europe and Europeans;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) teab vene kirjanike tekste, mis on pühendatud Euroopale ja eurooplastele.

learning_outcomes.en: 3)  is capable to describe those texts in historical and cultural context.
learning_outcomes.et: 3) saab interpreteerida neid tekste ajaloo ja kultuuri kontekstis.

independent_work.et: Obligatory texts will be read for the seminars during the term and discussed at the seminars. The films will be discussed during the seminars

description.et: The quality of the final essay; the ability of the student to to prove his/her point of view on the subject; the activity in the class during the discussions

grade_preconditions.et:
Final exam will be held at the end of May or in June, during the examination session, the exact date will be discussed with the students (one of the possibilities to pass the exam is 29 May 2025). 
In order to pass the exam a student has to write an essay, which should encompass:
1) analysis of the movie or literary text or travelogue chosen by the student from the given list or independently (except the films or texts which were discussed in detail during classes). The aim is to reflect on the topic of national stereotypes or on the other issue within the present course; 
or
2) reasoning on the case, independently chosen by the student, from the point of view of the issues within the present course.
The topic has to be confirmed by the teachers.
The volume of essay should be about 3000 words plus a list of references (sources used). The references are necessarily required.
The essay has to be submitted before May 15, 2025.

The exam will be held in the form of discussion between the student and the teacher on the issues of student's essay. During the exam the feedback will be given to each student individually. The student will be asked to defend his or her ideas and statements. Additional questions will be asked if there is any necessity to clarify the issue (they echo the issues discussed during the classes).

grade_evaluation.et:
The course is graded using the scale from A to F, where F indicates that the course is failed. 
The following scheme will be used while calculating the course grade:
Final exam: essay and discussion on its topic and additional questions on the issues from the course (if needed)  70% of course grade
Participation and verbal activity 30% of course grade

topic.et: Problem “Russia and Europe” in nowadays context

description.et: 1. Problem “Russia and Europe” in the changing world and in the context of Russian war against Ukraine. Can nowadays Russia be considered a European country? Where is the boarder? Is the situation irreversible? - general discussion

topic.et: Europe and Russia – two worlds and two myths

description.et: 2. Europe and Russia – two worlds and two myths. How did they appear? The issue of stereotypes. How do stereotypes appear? Parody „Ograblenie po…“ („ -styled robbery)“.
3. The clash of stereotypes - on the basis of the film “Peculiarities of the National Hunt“.
4. Francomania and Francophobia in Russia as a reflection of the situation in Europe (D. Fonvizin. “Letters from Abroad”).
5. Anglomania - the European fad in Russia.
6. Russophilia and Russophobia in Europe: A. de Custine. “La Russie en 1839” as a key-text.
7.  Anti-European sentiment in Russia: F. Dostoyevsky. “Winter Notes on Summer Impressions” compared with Fonvizin’s “Letters from Abroad”.
8 Russophilia and Russophobia in Europe in the 19th and in the 20th centuries on various examples

topic.et: Attitude to Russia after the 1917th revolution

description.et: 9 How did the Russian Revolution change the attitude of the Western world to Russia. Soviet = Russian? European intellectuals of Soviet Russia (Reed, Wells). Fragments of the film "Reds".
10. Russia behind the Iron Curtain on the basis of the book of A. Gide "Return from the USSR").

topic.et: Soviet peoples' idea about Western world

description.et: 11.  Western world in the false mirror of the closed Soviet society (on the basis of the film "Hipsters").
12.  Soviet and Western myths and reality (on the basis of the film" White Nights")
